snippet: Those in New York City looking to take photographs of the so-called supermoon had to make do with other amusements under a cloudy sky on Saturday night.
abstract: Cloudy New York City skies obscure views of the so-called supermoon over the weekend, phenomenon that occurs once a year when the Moon is full and in a closer-than-normal orbit to earth.
lead_paragraph: Those in New York City looking to take photographs of the so-called supermoon had to make do with other amusements under a cloudy sky on Saturday night.

headline.seo: ‘Supermoon,’ Obscured by Clouds, Left Plenty to See
headline.main: Obscured, ‘Supermoon’ Still Leaves Plenty to See
headline.print_headline: Obscured, ‘Supermoon’ Still Leaves Plenty to See
